wiki.summary: “Royalty” is a posthumous release from XXXTENTACION featuring Vybz Kartel, Stefflon Don, and Ky-Mani Marley. It serves as the lead single for X’s fourth studio and second posthumous album, Bad Vibes Forever. All artists on “Royalty” have Jamaican roots. Vybz Kartel was born in Kingston, Jamaica, Stefflon Don is ethnically Jamaican though she was born in the United Kingdom, and Ky-Mani Marley is one of the sons of the legendary Jamaican musician Bob Marley. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Royalty” is a posthumous release from XXXTENTACION featuring Vybz Kartel, Stefflon Don, and Ky-Mani Marley. It serves as the lead single for X’s fourth studio and second posthumous album, Bad Vibes Forever. All artists on “Royalty” have Jamaican roots. Vybz Kartel was born in Kingston, Jamaica, Stefflon Don is ethnically Jamaican though she was born in the United Kingdom, and Ky-Mani Marley is one of the sons of the legendary Jamaican musician Bob Marley. X briefly spoke about his Jamaican roots in a 2016 Periscope session while taking shots at Drake regarding the “Look At Me!” controversy, saying: Tell this pussy nigga Drake, stop speaking Patois! You are not Jamaican! I’m a real fucking Jamaican, I’m from fucking Kingston, all of my family is from Kingston, stop stealing my people’s culture. “Royalty” was extensively previewed in several memorials after X’s death in June 2018. The song’s release date and its cover art were announced by X’s mother shortly before its scheduled released on July 19, 2019. The song’s cover art, designed by Dylan Noir features the Jamaican flag laid over the hand design from the back of the infamous REVENGE brand KILL hoodies: Read more on Last.fm.
